metadata.name: WMIC Unquoted Services Path Lookup - PowerShell
metadata.comment: Detects known WMI recon method to look for unquoted service paths, often used by pentest inside of powershell scripts attackers enum scripts

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('get-wmiobject ')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('gwmi '))) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower(' win32_service ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('name')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('displayname')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('pathname')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('startmode')))

output.summary: Detects known WMI recon method to look for unquoted service paths, often used by pentest inside of powershell scripts attackers enum scripts
